channel.title: Worldswitching(not using SCSS)
channel.description: any idea's on how to do this, i dont want to use SCSS cause it takes years to load, and if you click outside the area you specified with the crosshair, that part is not selected anymore... so al the coords dont work anymore

item.title: Worldswitching(not using SCSS)
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“XxKanexX, post:7, topic:36345”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=51806.msg645267#msg645267 date=1166496528]
Disable javascript in your browser, and go here, when you get to the world page copy the world link and use “OpenWebPage(‘http://www.run escape.com/serverlolols’)l”.
[/quote][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=51806.msg648962#msg648962 date=1166554533]
To find run escape use:

FindWindowBySize(766, 504);
ActivateClient;
[/quote]
Stop calling it “run escape”… You’re going to confuse people.
Just stay with “runescape”.[/quote]

I think I already did.

Read full topic

item.title: Worldswitching(not using SCSS)
item.dc:creator: @Hex_Key Hex Key
item.description:
@Hex_Key wrote:

Thanks un-named, your pretty much the most useful person on this forum.

So could i make my script find the entire cleint window on fullscreen (for the worl select menu)
Then once a world has been clicked refing the actual RS clent window by using that function twice and working out what size the entire window is?

Read full topic

item.title: Worldswitching(not using SCSS)
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

FindWindowBySize(Height, Width : Integer);

To get the size of the run escape window, select it as a client and use GetClientDimensions(Width, Height : Integer);

For run escape, you would use:

FindWindowBySize(766, 504);
ActivateClient;

Read full topic
